summary: Enhanced extraction methods to handle bill ID/session fallback properly, improve date pattern matching for 'House of Representatives' context, expand MRSA code reference detection, and add initiated bill detection.

issues_addressed.issue: Bill ID and Session Extraction Failure
issues_addressed.root_cause: Fallback component extraction logic exists but may not be properly triggered or validated
issues_addressed.fix: Ensured fallback logic is always attempted and improved session extraction with better ordinal format handling

issues_addressed.root_cause: Date appears after 'House of Representatives,' context which wasn't explicitly handled
issues_addressed.fix: Expanded date patterns to recognize dates after chamber location markers like 'House of Representatives,' in addition to 'In House,'

issues_addressed.root_cause: MRSA references like '35-A MRSA ยง4002' not captured, only Title/Section format supported
issues_addressed.fix: Added MRSA pattern matching with ยง symbol and section variations like '5 MRSA ยง12004-G'

issues_addressed.issue: Sponsors Extraction for Initiated Bills Ambiguous
issues_addressed.root_cause: Empty sponsors list could mean either no sponsors found or initiated bill with no sponsors
issues_addressed.fix: Added helper method _is_bill_initiated() to explicitly detect initiated bills marked as 'I.B. X'

testing_notes: This bill 131-LD-1611 is an initiated bill (I.B. 2) with no legislator sponsors. It contains numerous MRSA references throughout (35-A MRSA, 5 MRSA, 21-A MRSA, etc.). The date 'April 11, 2023' appears after 'House of Representatives,' not 'In House,'. The session '131st' and LD number '1611' appear separately in the document header.
confidence_improvement: Expected to achieve ~0.95+ confidence with these improvements, capturing all major metadata fields present in this bill type
